what: Simulated Data: the Longitudinal Study of Australian Children (LSAC) — LSACdata
title: Simulated Data: the Longitudinal Study of Australian Children (LSAC) — LSACdata
text: dataset contains simulated data based Longitudinal Study Australian Children (LSAC). data comprises 5,107 rows 10 columns, missing values.

title: Simulated Data: the Longitudinal Study of Australian Children (LSAC) — LSACdata
Simulated Data: the Longitudinal Study of Australian Children (LSAC) — LSACdata
text: data.frame 5,107 rows, containing following variables: sep binary exposure variable fam_stress binary intermediate confounder parent_mh binary mediator preschool_att binary mediator child_mh binary outcome variable child_sex: binary baseline confounder child_atsi binary baseline confounder mat_cob binary baseline confounder mat_engl binary baseline confounder mat_age binary baseline confounder

what: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
title: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
text: Identifies appropriate family type ("binomial()" "gaussian()") set variables.

title: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
text: data data.frame containing variables analyzed. variable_names character vector specifying names variables evaluate. variable name correspond column data.frame. unique_threshold integer value specifying minimum number unique values required variable classified continuous. Defaults 10.

title: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
text: list element corresponds variable variable_names, value indicates family type: either "binomial()" binary variables "gaussian()" continuous variables.

what: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
text: function performs actual causal mediation analysis estimate interventional effects mapped hypothetical target trial.

title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
code: medRCT.fun(   dat,   ind = 1:nrow(dat),   first = first,   K = K,   fam_type = fam_type,   interactions_XC = interactions_XC,   intervention_type = intervention_type,   mcsim )

title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. ind vector indices specifying subset dat use analysis. Defaults rows dat. parameter particularly useful using function within boot() function boot package, enables resampling specifying subsets data. first integer specifying index first mediator interest combined list intermediate confounders mediators. K integer specifying total number mediators included analysis. Mediators considered sequentially based order. fam_type character string specifying family type use modeling mediators. Options typically include "gaussian" continuous mediators "binomial" binary mediators, among others. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed accounting flow-effects causal descendent mediators. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform.

what: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
title: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
text: 'medRCT' used estimate interventional effects mapping observational data hypothetical target trial. can handle multiple mediators, including primary interest exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders.

title: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
code: medRCT(   dat,   exposure,   outcome,   mediators,   intermediate_confs,   confounders,   interactions_XC = "all",   intervention_type = c("all", "shift_all", "shift_k", "shift_k_order"),   mcsim,   bootstrap = TRUE,   boot_args = list(R = 100, stype = "i", ci.type = "norm"),   ... )

title: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. include variables exposure, outcome, mediators, confounders, exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders specified analysis. exposure character string specifying name exposure variable dataset. exposure variable can categorical, 0 explicitly denoting unexposed (control) group. values represent different exposure categories. outcome character string specifying name outcome variable dataset. outcome variable can specified either binary continuous. mediators character vector specifying names mediator variables dataset. mediators can specified either binary continuous. intermediate_confs character vector specifying names intermediate confounders dataset. intermediate confounders can specified either binary continuous. NULL, intermediate confounders specified, natural effect estimated. confounders character vector listing names baseline confounders. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed accounting flow-effects causal descendent mediators. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform. bootstrap logical value indicating whether bootstrapping performed. TRUE (default), bootstrapping conducted using boot function boot package. boot_args list arguments bootstrapping. default settings : R: Number bootstrap replicates (default: 100). stype: Specifies statistic type passed boot function (default: ""). ci.type: Specifies type confidence interval compute (default: "norm"). ... Additional arguments passed boot function boot package.

what: Summarise Results from Mediation Analysis — summary.medRCT
title: Summarise Results from Mediation Analysis — summary.medRCT
text: Provides summary results obtained mediation analysis conducted using medRCT function.

title: Summarise Results from Mediation Analysis — summary.medRCT
Summarise Results from Mediation Analysis — summary.medRCT
text: object object class medRCT. ... Additional arguments customise summary output.
